Storage volume (General Purpose SSD (gp2)), Storage amount (30 GB), Nodes (2), Instance Type (db.m2.xlarge), Utilization (On-Demand only) (100 %Utilized/Month), Deployment Option (Multi-AZ), Pricing Model (OnDemand), Additional backup storage (30 GB), Total Size of Backup Processed for Export (GB) (50000 per month)

column1: * AWS Pricing Calculator provides only an estimate of your AWS fees and doesn't include any taxes that might apply. Your actual fees depend on a variety of factors, including your actual usage of AWS services.

In order to fit in the reduced budget, I scaled back on the DB instance size (m3-> m2) assuming there will not be noticeable difference. Also scaled back EC2 instances from 16 to 12 and added a comute savings plan, although I did not include an upfront payment. Depending
on requirements, this could have helped reduce the budget further. Also changed S3 outbound Data Transfer to Amazon Cloudfront which is free.
